clinical_study.brief_title: Virtual Reality Relaxation to Decrease Dental Anxiety
clinical_study.official_title: Virtual Reality Relaxation to Decrease Dental Anxiety in Primary Dental Care

brief_summary.textblock: The aim is to apply short-term virtual reality relaxation to examine if it is effective in reducing pre-operative dental anxiety in primary health care using an RCT.

detailed_description.textblock: Randomized controlled single-center trial with two parallel arms: Virtual Reality Relaxation (VRR) and Treatment As Usual (TAU) in a public oral health care unit. VRR group receiving a 1-3.5 minute 360° video immersing them in peaceful virtual landscape with audio features and sound supporting the relaxing experience. TAU groups remaining seated for 3 minutes in similar setting.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Randomized controlled single-center trial with two parallel arms
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: post-test measured with Modified Dental Anxiety Scale, The measure has five questions, each with five reply alternatives from not anxious to extremely anxious (on a scale 1-5), MDAS sums up to the total scale (range 5-25) which is used as primary outcome. Higher scores indicate higher dental anxiety.

secondary_outcome.measure: Anticipatory dental anxiety and treatment related dental anxiety
secondary_outcome.description: The secondary outcome variables are post-test scores for the two sub-scales of the MDAS referred to as 'anticipatory' (MDAS items 1 and 2) and 'treatment' dental anxiety (MDAS items 3, 4 and 5). Scales for sum up as anticipatory anxiety (Items 1 and 2: range 2-10) and treatment anxiety (Items 3-5, range 3-15). Higher scores indicate higher dental anxiety

arm_group.description: Virtual reality relaxation using virtual landscape and audio features and sound
Seated in similar environment as experimental group for same time

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- attending for dental treatment
- consenting
- able to complete Finnish questionnaire without assistance
- age 18 years or older
Exclusion Criteria:
- those not meeting inclusion criteria
